intro: Mascarenhasia thiryana, commonly known as the Mascarenhasia thiryana, is a rare flowering plant native to the Mascarene Islands in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. It thrives in coastal areas with well-drained soil and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native region. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
